22617.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4f0fh","text":"Wash hermaphrodites off plate with several ml of M9 solution and transfer to 15ml falcon tube (Fisher Scientific-Falcon 352096)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6gje6","text":"Fill falcon tube up to 15ml with M9 solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eodli","text":"Centrifuge for 2 minutes at 1500 rpm (RCF:210, ascending 9; descending 7) – program 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"408q1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"edr02","text":"Program 1 retains the worms as pellets and the bacteria is suspended as the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"beln7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ua7c","text":"The descending is slow as the worm pellet is lose at this stage which we don't want to break","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brvgo","text":"Remove supernatant using a plastic Pasteur pipette taking care not to disturb pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8f130","text":"Leave atleast 0.5ml M9 to avoid disturbing the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"36rit","text":"Fill the tube with M9 upto 15ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4h9b5","text":"Spin program 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3k1sq","text":"Repeat steps 4-6 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jndd","text":"On final wash remove as much supernatant as possible and add M9 upto 4ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8ln5","text":"Add 4ml 2X Bleach solution  (From here onwards try to work as quickly as possible to avoid over-exposure of the worms  to the bleach)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d6pj9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bokll","text":"USE FRESHLY PREPARED BLEACH EVERYTIME","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1lk6t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":19,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"a90u5","text":"2X Bleach solution:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cssea","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3j2c7","text":"5% Sodium hypochlorite solution - 4ml","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qb43","text":"Sterile water - 3.5 ml","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bkrpr","text":"1M NaOH solution - 2.5 ml","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ites","text":"TOTAL - 10 ml","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62r2v","text":"Vortex on maximum setting for 4 min (no more as this will damage the eggs) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qu9k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8a6od","text":"Makesure the vortex forms ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61r7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"etoc6","text":"After vortexing, top up the tube with M9 till 15ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cahme","text":"Centrifuge for 2 mins at 2500rpm (RCF:590, ascending 9; descending 7) – program 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cj03q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"70c74","text":"(Always check the program on the centrifuge before using it)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7khv7","text":"Remove supernatant by pouring into waste bottle – pellet should be compact and yellow in colour at bottom of falcon, but be careful not to lose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bm3b6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f2u92","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"65rd8","text":"Add 15ml M9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"48ltj","text":"Centrifuge at program 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2rd9","text":"Repeat steps 12-14 four more times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e54tp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"46ji2","text":"The number of washes is crucial here as we need to get rid of all the bleach","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9mqmn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgjjt","text":"After final wash add 15ml M9 and store eggs/larvae in the falcon on the rotator that is constantly spinning at 20oC, until feeding  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":113,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43o4r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4i5o4","text":"L1 arrested larvae can be starved for up to 5 days before refeeding","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7p1in","text":"Centrifuge larvae on program 2 to pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"gjoo","text":"Remove supernatant with plastic Pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1h9rc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1qu2","text":"The pellet is lose here so makesure not to disturb it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7nji7","text":"Add 15ml M9, spin to wash","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"75gje","text":"On final wash leave 0.5ml M9 in falcon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2qb4g","text":"Resuspend the pellet by gently tapping the tube/flicking it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

35969.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"av8j1","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4d1lk","text":"Turn on the compressor at the wall – it should show a pressure of 40psi after switched on","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ftkhd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"84DD6A0083AF11EA97D413EC378F4AA9","height":245.70909090909092,"id":213164,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bj8ti","text":"COPAS wormsorter indicating key components","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"COPAS.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gqhj2y96.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gsfn2y96.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gsfm2y96.webp","width":580}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8fgqq","text":"Turn on COPAS machine with switch on the left hand side","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6h9u","text":"Turn on the lasers (488 laser sufficient if using unmarked animals). Add in picture of lasers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"828es","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rjm3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7btqh","text":"Turn on the computer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pp98","text":"Discard waste contents that are in the recovery cup (small shallow cup on the left-hand side of the machine)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6n35f","text":"Check that there is water in the sheath. If the water is low, fill up with MQH2O (not M9).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ts45","text":"Make sure that the recovery cup and sample cup are securely tightened so that there are no leaks in the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"332j6","text":"Open dbgview – should always be running in the background","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4qjh","text":"Open FlowPilot software and a prepared experiment with a set gate for eg Adults. :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"122o5","text":"File -\u003e Load Experiment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2g70d","text":"File -\u003e Load sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cb4ag","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Flush Sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2o0q","text":"Click ‘Refill Sample’ – the sample cup pressure should decrease. You can see this in the software on the left hand size (include screenshot).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"didlp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3a3ae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7j3jt","text":"Sometimes the sample cup pressure doesn’t decrease and in fact increases. You can still unscrew the sample cup but if this persists there may be a blockage.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8s8ur","text":"Unscrew sample cup and replace with falcon filled with cleaning solution (pink in colour)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7jp0p","text":"Once securely replaced click ‘Done refill’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8upab","text":"Check ‘Sample on’ and ‘mixer on’ – cleaning solution should now pass through the system; allow a 2-3 ml to pass through (make sure sheath is unchecked)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9k0us","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9ib8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"93ald","text":"You will get a warning about contaminating the flow cell, this normal and you can click 'Yes'","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8f7of","text":"Uncheck ‘Sample on’ or click Abort to stop sample flow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6pv62","text":"Repeat steps 11-15 with water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"emqh9","text":"Repeat steps 11-13 with sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kese","text":"Turn mixer ON. If you do not do this you may lose all your worms that have settled to the bottom of the tube!!!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g6cb","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Prime Flow Cell; to flush sample through the system and remove air bubbles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c357v","text":"Maintenance -\u003e Flush sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8hqf3","text":"Check 488nm (and 568nm) laser boxes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93r3d","text":"Check ‘Use sort gate’ for stored sort gate – include screenshot of software here","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fdpk","text":"Click ‘Acquire’ – sample should pass through the system and number of events per second will be shown:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1hkr5","text":"Aim for 10-20 events per second","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5j40e","text":"If too few/too many events increase/decrease ‘Sample cup pressure’ so that it is between 1.5-2psi","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dbf4l","text":"To ensure only one event per droplet go to Setup-\u003eCoincidence, select ‘Pure, no double’. This increases accuracy in the number of worms dispensed but the time to dispense may increase.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ap4fe","text":"Click on the plate icon on the top bar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"mlt3","text":"Select number of objects to sort","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7n17k","text":"Select the wells you would like to fill (for testing we use a spare 60mm plate and fill wells A1, A2, B1, B2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c9qmr","text":"Select which gate to use","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dch5e","text":"Apply","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u7k3","text":"Place 60mm plate in front left corner of left-hand stage with A1 in the left corner.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2g0ur","text":"Click ‘Fill plate’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6c6mb","text":"Keep an eye on the number of events per second","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6sik0","text":"Ensure the ‘Diverter pressure’ is checked","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cljfn","text":"Check under microscope that the correct number of objects were dispensed per ‘well’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brb6p","text":"If too many objects, decrease sample cup pressure and repeat steps 8-11 or select Pure no double to increase accuracy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"59t6k","text":"Click on the plate icon on the top bar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ism8","text":"‘Clear plate’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"mcv","text":"Select number of objects per well and click ‘Apply to All’ or select which wells you would like to fill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d7dhm","text":"Apply","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b56bj","text":"Place 96 well plate in left-hand stage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8egts","text":"Ensure ‘Diverter pressure’ is checked’; if it is not then liquid comes out of the dispenser constantly and you get flooding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7jg5m","text":"‘Fill plate’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmi3c","text":"Keep an eye on the number of events per second still and monitor how much sample fluid is coming through the system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5mrl","text":"Repeat steps 11-15","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7chi1","text":"Keep sample cup with water secured so that the system is air-tight and closed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3ntsk","text":"Turn off all equipment (Computer, lasers, compressor, worm sorter).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

42691.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"33vs9","text":"Prepare a 250ml bottle of hot milliQ water in the microwave and keep in the waterbath along with the agar. The water is important to have on hand in case of tubing blockages.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"51doc","text":"Insert large cassette into the machine ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4m0e7","text":"Configure X, Y, and Z settings for the multiwell plate by clicking on tool symbol -\u003e stage alignment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"161a0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"54ihu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ekfnd","text":"For UNIPLATE96SQWLF 650U:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ka4l","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b3cpf","text":"X = 95.6","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1t6n","text":"Y = 4.2","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1c5oj","text":"Z = -22.5","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cimvt","text":"\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ao756","text":"For 48WP:","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vkc8","text":"Put the plate into the stage and then press 'Move' so that the plate moves so that it is under the dispensing cassette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8cum","text":"Use the up and down arrows to move the pipette tip so that they hover just over the plate and make note of the height (this will be entered into the dispensing program at a later step). Press 'Fast/Slow' button to switch between fast and slow movements.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjhcv","text":"Use the X, Y arrows to move the plate so that the pipette tips are centered in the middle of column 5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dp8b9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cqqpg","text":"Save all settings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"408bt","text":"Exit settings by pressing the back button","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed30p","text":"Press on the program you wish to use (see later for configuring your own program)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"devtr","text":"Make sure that the correct cassette is listed and change if necessary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jpm6","text":"Select the volume you wish to dispense","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"urjb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"11hld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9a5eh","text":"For 96WP:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53qop","text":"200 μL","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5gusm","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5i8r","text":"Select 'set height' and set the appropriate height for tip height (usually all the same)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3cuh","text":"Place the end of the tubing from the casettee into the agar that is being kept warm in the water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5shbd","text":"Press 'Prime' to prime the tubing and allow to finish so that agar flows from the pipette tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ers0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eflmm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qvfo","text":"IMPORTANT:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"j6hg","text":"Once the agar is in the tubing it is important to act quickly to avoid agar solidifying and causing blockages. If you are particularly concerned about agar cooling in the tubing, wrap the tubing in aluminium foil to keep hot.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

cases.title: Unblocking the tubing
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5j1a2","text":"If the tubing does block, clear the blockage by 'reverse priming' as much of the agar as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3v61","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dpkc","text":"Then place tube ends in the hot water and prime continuously with hot water until the water runs all the way through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b05rb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ceof","text":"If you are having trouble getting the water through, squeeze and massage parts of the tubing where you can see blockages to force the agar along and allow the water to pass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5sme","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r489","text":"Once all cleared, 'reverse prime', and reprime with the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

42691.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"86cme","text":"Place a clean plate in the stage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ej3s","text":"Press run and then plate should fill with agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9o0bu","text":"Repeat steps 11-12 until all the plates have been filled.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97j18","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"25sir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c4eh","text":"Little drops of agar can solidify on the tip ends. It is often good to remove these drops using a pipette tip every few runs so that blockages do not occur. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"83lh","text":"'Reverse prime' all the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1tkvv","text":"Place the tubing ends into the hot water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2qk6v","text":"Prime so that the water runs through and clears all the agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fhse3","text":"Reverse prime to remove the water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7dvv5","text":"Release tension from the tubing and remove cassette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8vp46","text":"Double wrap the cassette in aluminium foil for autoclaving","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

50466.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8qo","text":"Book the autoclave via the notebook on top of the machine. It will take around 2 hours for a 500ml bottle and 2.5 hours for 1L or larger bottles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jj02","text":"Take clean bottles and measuring cylinders from the glass kitchen - you will also need one bottle for the autoclave probe, which should be the size of the largest bottle you are autoclaving. Get sterile water from the media room.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqgpl","text":"Measure out all the pre-autoclave reagents and add to the bottle. Use a new weighing boat and spatula for each reagent. Add water last and mix thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2ep84","text":"Add equivalent amount of water to the empty probe bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eo4sm","text":"Make sure the lid of your media bottle is not screwed completely when placing it inside the autoclave machine. Label with autoclave tape (‘NGM agar Rm 5020’), and place over the lid to prevent it coming off in the autoclave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5jjv","text":"Turn ON the autoclave and touch the screen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ablsr","text":"If 'Fill with water' is on the screen, fill up the autoclave with sterile water until it reaches the grill/'Water Level OK' appears on the screen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"961r1","text":"Place the probe bottle inside the autoclave with the temperature probe inside.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2onr5","text":"Place the bottles in the autoclave and make sure that the cap is not screwed completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c5oqc","text":"Check the waste flask is not too full","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bo7m","text":"(On the screen) LOCK --\u003e START --\u003e MEDIA 121X15 BALLAST --\u003e Start","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eai23","text":"Remove the probe and media bottles using gloves (the bottles will be hot)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86m7v","text":"Leave the agar on a lab bench to cool to around 55°C, ie the bottle is cool enough to hold for a second with a gloved hand","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f1hh","text":"Try not to shake the bottle too much while mixing to avoid air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6bqks","text":"The agar needs to be warm to be poured without blocking the tubings, so try to pour as quickly as possible and if not poured immediately put the bottle on a waterbath set to 60C until being used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c9cgj","text":"Protocol for comparing the effects of various compounds on the phenotype our ret-1 (RTN2 ortholog) LoF mutant vs N2 control.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":77,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":84,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Pick L4 worms for bleaching (9 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a4mep","text":"Pick 10 x L4 worms onto 10 x 90mm NGM-agar plates pre-seeded with E. coli OP50 for each strain to be tested. In this case we are comparing the response of our ret-1 LoF mutant with N2 (parental control), therefore 20 x 90 mm plates will be picked in total.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":66,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":159,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare drug source plates (up to 3 days before first day of tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6nnpq","text":"Prepare 96-well source plates with stocks of all the compounds and concentrations to be tested. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4c6h9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v0it","text":"Note: It is best to shuffle around the position of compounds within the source plate to overcome any potential edge effects","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":123}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare drug source plates (up to 3 days before first day of tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bvt36","text":"Weigh out compounds using a micro balance and dissolve in an appropriate solvent (sterile water or DMSO) to achieve x1000 the highest concentration that will be tested (this accounts for dilution of compounds when adding to the tracking plates).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"157d0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dji6","text":"For example, to test at a compound at a maximum concentration of 100 µM, a 100 mM top stock of the compound is required","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":119}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare drug source plates (up to 3 days before first day of tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5noat","text":"Perform a 10-fold serial dilution of the top-stock of each compound, using the same solvent initially used to dissolve the compounds.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bjrl","text":"For example, mix 50 µL 0.1 M compound top stock with 450 µL solvent and vortex (yielding 0.01 M concentration)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":110}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare drug source plates (up to 3 days before first day of tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"asq47","text":"Repeat previous step (using the newly generated dilute compound) to obtain all desired concentrations to be tested.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare drug source plates (up to 3 days before first day of tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2iuam","text":"Dispense 50 µL of the drug stocks into the relevant wells of a 96-well v-bottomed microtitre plate. Remember to include control wells (i.e. drug solvent only) and label the plates (unique plate ID and date) with a frost-proof marker pen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare drug source plates (up to 3 days before first day of tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bbpm7","text":"Use a plate seal to seal source plates, and store at -20°C until use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d21jm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8sbkn","text":"For this experiment 3 unique source plates were generated","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Pour 96-well tracking plates (up to 4 days before tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ft1kt","text":"Prepare 2 L no peptone NGM-agar and autoclave.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f0g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7tba","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a7o1e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":50466,"title":"Making no peptone NGM for imaging plates","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eMaking no peptone NGM for imaging plates\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"making-no-peptone-ngm-for-imaging-plates-bvian4ae","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Bonnie Evans","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"bonnie-evans","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/013.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/013.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":18},"type_id":1,"guid":"19E11420C74711EDB3FCB33F0D19C87E"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87icn","text":"Once agar has cooled to around 62°C , add the post-autoclave salts and cholesterol then dispense agar into square 96-well plates using VIAFILL dispenser. Dispense 200 µL  per well. Once cooled, store agar side up (plate lids on) in an airtight container at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99mpg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dcihe","text":"For this experiment 24 tracking plates are imaged per day: pour 75 plates total","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":42691,"title":"Dispensing agar into multiwell plates","title_html":"Dispensing agar into multiwell plates","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"dispensing-agar-into-multiwell-plates-bmxbk7in","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Saul   Moore","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"saul---moore","link":null,"image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/f73577561f86bbe233b0a4ec1c086797e859f8e5c9bf0fcbf1ee27b9af38e967/br323npw.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":23},"type_id":1,"guid":"87560380C74711EDB3FCB33F0D19C87E"}}}}

steps.section: Dry plates and bleach worms (5 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"brhop","text":"Dry 14 x 150 mm NGM-agar plates per strain (7 plates for ret-1 mutant and 7 plates for N2) in the drying cabinet (setting 2) for 3 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":57,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry plates and bleach worms (5 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e0jfb","text":"Seed 150 mm plates with E. coli OP50 and leave to dry on bench at room temperature overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry plates and bleach worms (5 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1h6os","text":"Bleach synchronise worms prepared in step 1 and leave in diapause for 2 days at 20°C on a rotator that is constantly spinning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1g98","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fbsio","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":22617,"title":"Bleach synchronisation of C. elegans","title_html":"Bleach synchronisation of C. elegans","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"bleach-synchronisation-of-c-elegans-2bzgap6","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Ida Barlow","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"ida-barlow","link":null,"image":{"source":"/img/avatars/011.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/011.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":22},"type_id":1,"guid":"E7619190C74711EDB3FCB33F0D19C87E"}}}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cto7h","text":"Pre-label the 14 pre-seeded plates (prepared in step 5-6) with the relevant strain name and date, i.e. 7 x plates labelled \"N2\" and 7 x plates labelled \"ret-1 LoF\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":153,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2pmuf","text":"At 16:45, spin L1s (prepared in step 7) for day 1 of tracking using centrifuge program 1 (1500 rpm for 2 mins).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3dbgh","text":"Use a 3 mL plastic pasteur pipette to carefully remove the supernatant (leaving ~1 mL) then resuspend the worm pellet by gently flicking the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b4hd","text":"At 17:00, use a clean rubber teat and glass pipette per strain, carefully aspirate the L1 worm suspension and drop 4 small droplets onto the bacterial lawn of the pre-seeded/pre-labelled 150mm nursery plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"28u4n","text":"Incubate, agar-side down, at 20°C for 15 mins to allow the droplets containing L1 worms to dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Refeed L1s (3 days prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"tlgo","text":"Flip plates to be agar-side up and allow to grow at 20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ia0n","text":"In the morning, remove 24 square well 96-well plate from the cold room (prepared in steps 3-4) and weigh three random plates without their lids","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18kms","text":"\nNote: Number of plates will depend on the experiment being conducted","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3kmdm","text":"Allow plates to dry, with lids off, in the drying cabinet (setting 2) until they have reduced in weight by 3-5% (~1.5 - 2 hours).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"832h","text":"Pre-label dried tracking plates (step 10) with the imaging run and drug information, so that every plate on a single day of imaging has a unique plate id. For example ret-1_02_rep8, where:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqui0","text":"- 'ret-1' is the strain to be tested","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ck7m","text":"- '_02' is the unique drug source plate number","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e93no","text":"- '_rep8' is the imaging run number that day","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8sftf","text":"Remove drug source plates (made in section 2) from the -20 °C freezer and allow to thaw at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4fgtq","text":"Briefly spin drug source plates in the mini bench-top plate spinner (~15 seconds) to collect all plate contents at the bottom of the wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bbk1k","text":"Pre-label skirted 96-well PCR plates with drug source plate information (e.g. ret-1_01) that will be used to make up the diluted drug plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3bk0q","text":"Next to a flame, dispense 9 µL of sterile water into each well of the pre-labeled dilution plates (step 14) using multichannel pipette and reagent reservoir.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"917jg","text":"Using VIAFLO multi-well dispenser on the 'Tom_Stock_Dilution' custom program, premix drug in the drug source plates [position A of VIAFLO], and then transfer 1 µL drug in DMSO to the diluted drug plates prefilled with water (step 15) [position B of VIAFLO].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"faahe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9m0bh","text":"This creates a 1:10 dilution of the master compound stock, i.e. 100 mM -\u003e 10 mM drug in diluted source plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":108}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c66d7","text":"Repeat for all drug stock plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9a6il","text":"Working one plate at a time (so that plates don't dry before drugs are added), use the VIAFILL (with the small  cassette) to dispense 5 µL of sterile deionised water onto a pre-dried imaging plate (step 10).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"gv87","text":"Use VIAFLO on the 'Tom_Agar' custom program to transfer 2.05 µL of diluted drug and water mixture onto the corresponding pre-labelled tracking plate [position A of VIAFLO].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qsps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5mmm","text":"This uses the formula below to perform a further 1:100 dilution of the compound, i.e. 10 mM diluted drug stock -\u003e 100 µM final imaging plate concentration:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":155}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"po58","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu2th","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1mk7g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0AA77DE0C7CF11EDB3FCB33F0D19C87E","height":30.58181818181819,"id":353275,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screenshot 2023-03-21 at 09.59.10.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k297bipyp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k295bipyp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/k296bipyp.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/k294bipyp.webp","width":580}}}}

steps.section: Dry, dose and seed tracking plates (1 day prior to tracking)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"44s0l","text":"Repeat steps 18-19 until all tracking plates have been dosed with the relevant compounds.\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7huk3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rkpo","text":"Ensure optical density of OP50 bacterial stock is ~1.0 (an OD of 0.96 - 1.04 is acceptable).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"akhir","text":"Use the VIAFILL dispenser to seed all the tracking plates with 5 µL bacterial suspension per well and leave to dry (~20 mins).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a605v","text":"Flip tracking plates to be agar-side up, cover with an opaque box and leave at room temp overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"87r9c","text":"At 09:00, wash young adult worms off the 150 mm plates using M9 buffer, and a clean 3 mL pasteur pipette per strain, into  15 mL falcons.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a3afb","text":"Centrifuge using program 1 (1500 rpm for 2 mins) to pellet the worms.\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lia6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6jhvq","text":"Carefully remove and discard the supernatent and refill with M9 .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2069h","text":"Repeat steps 25-26.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2cvp8","text":"After final wash, fill 15 mL falcon with M9. Transfer contents to a clean 50ml falcon and top up to 45 mL with M9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekl3d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"n08f","text":"Use COPAS wormsorter to dispense 3 worms per well (pure, no double) into 5 imaging plates at a time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bk4t2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1pscl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":35969,"title":"COPAS wormsorter","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eCOPAS wormsorter\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"copas-wormsorter-bfc9jiz6","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Ida Barlow","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"ida-barlow","link":null,"image":{"source":"/img/avatars/011.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/011.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":47},"type_id":1,"guid":"E5B697E0C7CF11EDB3FCB33F0D19C87E"}}}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cnhto","text":"Allow liquid to dry by placing imaging plates in microbial safety cabinet (pre-sterilsed with 70% ethanol) with lids off for ~30 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dr5pi","text":"Track the behaviour of worms incubated on the drugs after 4 hours, as calculated from the median point of dispensing worms (middle wormsorter time), and allow worms 30 mins to acclimatise to conditions in the tracking room prior to imaging. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8724d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cppg1","text":"For example: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rmgh","text":"- Wormsorter start time = 10:00","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a1rl","text":"- Wormsorter end time = 10:40","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53r2u","text":"- Middle wormsorter time = 10:20","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vlkv","text":"\n4 hour exposure to drugs:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an1v1","text":"- Place in tracking room at 13:50","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21lnm","text":"- Start imaging run at 14:20","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7etcb","text":"Use a microscope to check that wells are dry and incubate, agar-side up, in the 20°C incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"89cod","text":"Image on the multi-camera tracker (Hydra) using 'run_syngenta_experiment_v2.py' protocol script: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vdbm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"estib","text":"1) 5 min pre-stimulus recording","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ngie","text":"2) 6 min blue light recording: 60 sec no light, [10 sec light ON, 90 sec light OFF] x 3     (6 min total)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"890sb","text":"3) 5 min post-stimulus recording","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Tracking
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6gfag","text":"Transfer videos to BehavGenom and analyse with Tierpsy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
